This coin is highly important: it is the sole example from the Tortugas wreck bearing both the Portuguese arms and the assayer initial ‘A’, thus definitively linking it to Alonso Turrillo de Yebra and his Nuevo Reino de Granada mints; it is also one of only four known existing Nuevo Reino de Granada coins struck with the date 1621
